conclusion: Understanding the problem about an ideal gas on a p-V diagram.
p-V diagram with points A, B, and C in a rectangle; pressures in 10^5 Pa, volumes in 10^-3 m³.
Temperature at state A is -73°C, which is 200 K.
Internal energy changes by 200 J from A to C; need to find heat Q exchanged.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q + W.
ΔU = 200 J; need to find Q, so need to determine W.
Process from A to C consists of A to B and B to C.
From A to B: pressure constant at 3×10^5 Pa, volume increases from 1×10^-3 m³ to 4×10^-3 m³.
Work done from A to B: W_AB = 900 J.
From B to C: volume constant at 4×10^-3 m³, pressure decreases from 3×10^5 Pa to 1×10^5 Pa.
Work done from B to C: W_BC = 0 J.
Total work done from A to C: W_total = 900 J.
Using first law: 200 J = Q - 900 J, so Q = 1100 J.
Internal energy for ideal gas depends on temperature: ΔU = n * c_v * ΔT.
Temperature at B: T_B = 200 K; Temperature at C: T_C ≈ 66.67 K.
Temperature change from A to C: T decreases from 200 K to 66.67 K.
Standard conditions: 1 mole occupies 22.4 L at 1 atm and 273 K.
